chargeHist.descr: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon H Wikel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon H Wikel

records.addlTxt:
08:34 AM Defendant Brandon H Wikel in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella by zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid within 60 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Cover letter dated 08-07-2022 re: community service hours completed, filed by Atty. Christopher Cherella
25 community service hours completed, filed by Atty. Christopher Cherella
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:08 PM Defendant Brandon H Wikel in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella. Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cherella states that upon Defendant's completion of 25 hours of community service, the State would amend to a citation only. Atty Cherella requests 90 days for his client to complete community service.  

Court will allow parties to appear by video, or for case to be resolved via stipulation and order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:38 AM Defendant Brandon H Wikel in court with attorney Peter Heflin for attorney Christopher J. Cherella.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Letter dated 03/15/2022 requesting adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 03/15/22. Denied. Pursuant to Marsy's law and the notification process the hearing will remain. Counsel may appear via Zoom if he wishes.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
